Package de.oth.blocklib.world.fluids

Class ActiveFluidManager

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.fluids.ActiveFluidManager
public class ActiveFluidManager
extends java.lang.Object
A class that is a part of the Context and gets updated by the game loop. It is responsible for managing all ActiveFluids. It can be used to create a fluid source of a chosen type at a chosen location.
Author:
Tobias Mueller

  • Method Details

    • addNewActiveFluid

      public void addNewActiveFluid​(ActiveFluid activeFluid)
      Specifies a new type of ActiveFluid. If that type of ActiveFluid was already defined, the method prints an error message.
      Parameters:
      activeFluid - the ActiveFluid that should be defined.

    • addFluidSource

      public void addFluidSource​(Vector3i position, float containedAmount, short type)
      Can be used to set a source of fluid anywhere into the world. If there is no ActiveFluid defined for the chosen type, a new one with default values will be automatically created.
      Parameters:
      position - the position where the fluid should be placed.
      containedAmount - the initial amount of fluid that the source should contain.
      type - the blockID of the type the fluid should have (e.g. lava).

    • addFluidSource

      public void addFluidSource​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f position, float containedAmount, short type)

      public void update​(float deltaTime)
